page.title: 09Building materials
page.content: The village bricks were made in North Cambridgeshire in Beckwell Whites. Clay was dug out of the pond and baked hard.the clunch for the cottages came from clunch pits in South Cambridgeshire and is chalk. The beams were of oak, the thatch, reed or straws. Windows were of lead with shutters. The new houses are often built of old materials to be in keeping with the old. The mill is made of Cambridge bricks and wood cladding and was grinding corn until the 1960's The mill house is one of the oldest houses in the village and is over 300 years old inside. The outside is about 100 years, for as the millers became better off they built a better house around the old one.
